extra.message: The `__html__` method indicates to the Django template engine that the value is 'safe' for rendering. This means that normal HTML escaping will not be applied to the return value. This exposes your application to cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. If you need to render raw HTML, consider instead using `mark_safe()` which more clearly marks the intent to render raw HTML than a class with a magic method.

cwe: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
